result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie G Cline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronnie G Cline is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronnie G Cline was found guilty of Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.453(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Ronnie G Cline with Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Brad Erickson from DOC in Court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(3:20)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - argues sentencing - recommendation 18 to 24 months supervision - 90 days jail on 14CF398 ct 5 - believes treatment court would be a good way to have support - submitted referral to Jenae - recommends 36 months prob - 180 days jail - court costs
Erickson - deft is absolute perfect fit for treatment court - he can't recommend it procedurally 
Chapman - reviewed PSI with deft - corrections gone over - agrees with PSI that probation is approp.  - requests probation - 180 days stayed
Deft - addresses the Court - was in out patient treatment and still engaged

COURT:  
14CF224 Ct 5 - $268 cc - $250 dna surchg - 36 mo probation concurrent to below - CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: eligible for treatment court and successfully complete - 90 days cond jail 
14CF380 Ct 1 - 24 mo probation - $243 cc - successful completion of treatment court 
14CF398 Ct 5 - $243 cc - $100 dom abuse surchg - 24 mo probation concurrent to above - 90 days jail as cond of prob and successful completion of treatment court - credit 67 days
14CF385 Ct 1 - 24 mo probation concurrent to above - $243 cc - 9 mo jail as cond (stayed if successfully completes treatment court)
if revoked credit of 79 days on 14CF380, 14CF224, 14CF385
BOND APPLIES
Not adding an addtl $250 dna on 14CF380, 14CF398, 14CF385
***report to jail forthwith*** can be released for health purposes - huber for AODA treatment
